body.prompt:
Generate a fake conversation between a customer and an agent.
The agent should introduce themselves, their company and give the customer
their name. The agent should ask for the customer's name.
As part of the conversation, have the agent ask for two pieces of
personal information.  Spell out numbers. For example, 1000 should be
said as one zero zero zero, not one thousand. The conversation should be
at least 10 lines long and be complete. At the end
of the conversation, the agent should thank the customer for their time
and end the conversation. Return the conversation formatted 
like the following example:

{'conversation': 
    [
    {'speaker': 'Agent', 'message': 'xxxxx'}, 
    {'speaker': 'Customer', 'message': "xxxxx."}, 
    {'speaker': 'Agent', 'message': "xxxxxx"}
    ] 
}


In this conversation, the agent's name is Alan Ward and the customer's name is Emily Morris.  The conversation is about a random business (a Pawn Shop ) and is a conversation about privacy.

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: Hello! My name is Alan Ward, and I represent Quick Cash Pawn Shop.

body.speaker: Customer
body.message: Hi Alan, nice to meet you!

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: It’s great to meet you too, Emily! How can I assist you today?

body.speaker: Customer
body.message: I have some concerns about privacy when pawning my items.

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: I completely understand, Emily. Your privacy is very important to us. Can I ask you your last name for our records?

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: Thank you, Emily Morris. And may I also have your phone number, please?

body.speaker: Customer
body.message: It's one two three four five six seven eight.

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: Perfect! I assure you that all your information will be kept confidential.

body.speaker: Customer
body.message: That makes me feel much better, thank you.

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: You’re welcome, Emily! Thank you for your time today, and if you have any further questions, feel free to reach out!
